DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : Eating diet high vegetable may slow disease progression patient prostate cancer . PURPOSE : This randomized clinical trial study well diet work alter disease progression patient prostate cancer active surveillance .
DOC.brief_title: Diet Altering Disease Progression Patients With Prostate Cancer Active Surveillance
DOC.detailed_description: CALGB 70807 randomize , phase III clinical trial design test practical , diet-based intervention prostate cancer broad clinical setting . Patients AS randomized either intervention centralize , telephone-based dietary counseling structure dietary education comparison control condition receive Prostate Cancer Foundation booklet . Study endpoint include disease progression , incidence treatment , health-related quality life . OBJECTIVES : Primary - To determine telephone-based dietary intervention compare intervention decrease clinical progression AS patient . Secondary - To compare incidence active treatment ( surgery , irradiation , local ablation , androgen deprivation ) AS patient receive dietary intervention compare intervention . - To compare prostate cancer-related anxiety AS patient receive dietary intervention compare intervention . - To compare health-related quality life AS patient receive dietary intervention compare intervention . OUTLINE : This multicenter study . Patients stratify accord age ( ≤ 70 year vs > 70 year ) , race ( black african american v ) , baseline prostate biopsy ( 0-12 month registration v > 12-24 month registration ) . Patients randomize 1 2 treatment arm . Please see arms section information .
DOC.criteria: Preregistration Eligibility : 1 . Histologic Documentation : The initial biopsy show diagnosis prostate cancer use purpose determine eligibility . However , subsequent biopsy perform patient enrollment show patient ineligible , may enrol study . Eligible patient must meet following criterion : Biopsyproven ( consist ≥ 10 tissue core ) adenocarcinoma prostate diagnose within 24 month prior preregistration < 25 % biopsy tissue core positive cancer ≤ 50 % one biopsy tissue core positive cancer Clinical stage ≤ T2a Patients prostate cancer distant metastasis eligible NOTE : If patient undergoes transurethral resection prostate ( TURP ) benign prostatic hyperplasia ( BPH ) , prostate cancer diagnose incidentally TURP specimen , eligibility CALGB 70807 determine TURP specimen . However , patient subsequently undergoes minimum 10core prostate biopsy within 2 year prostate cancer diagnosis TURP , prostate cancer detect biopsy specimen meet requirement , patient eligible study . If prostate cancer detect biopsy specimen , patient eligible . 2 . Prior Treatment : Patients prior treatment prostate cancer surgery , irradiation , local ablative ( i.e . cryosurgery highintensity focus ultrasound ) androgen deprivation therapy eligible . 3 . Patients history noncutaneous malignancy ( nonmelanoma skin cancer ) previous 5 year eligible . 4 . Language : Patients must able read comprehend English language text able understand speak English phone . 5 . Life expectancy least 3 year 6 . Patients currently take vitamin supplement include lycopene betacarotene eligible . 7 . Patients receive treatment 5alpha reductase inhibitor ( e.g. , finasteride , dutasteride ) within 90 day prior preregistration eligible . Treatment agent protocol intervention permit . 8 . Patients currently take coumadin eligible . 9 . Participants men age 50 80 year . 10 . For men ≤ 70 year , biopsy Gleason score ≤ 6 ; men > 70 year , biopsy Gleason score ≤ ( 3 + 4 ) = 7 . 11 . Required Initial Laboratory Values : Serum PSA < 10 ng/mL NOTE : Baseline PSA determination eligibility must measure discontinuation 5alpha reductase inhibitor . Registration Eligibility : 1 . Successful completion three 24hour dietary recall runin period . 2 . Patients consume ≥ 6 serving per day fruit vegetable ( include juice ) , determine runin dietary recall eligible .
